reviews.sentence: Excellent Customer Service Adriene Fehringer. On a recent business stay May 4 6 your hotel was booked due to a conference held on site. Adriene was able to accommodate 2last minute executives by providing rooms for them. She and the front desk Adrian and Karem went above and beyond to ensure our executives had rooms. Great teamwork and attention to customers. Thanks again and hope that management recognizes their outstanding performance. Much appreciate. Rich Cilia.

Good Hotel old bathroom Garage. I had a room on the 8th floor facing the 17th st and it was reasonably quiet. Comfortable room with 55 tv electronic minibar. safe. The bathroom appears very old despite some refreshed details such as the rain shower in the tub. The towels were not always adequate. Service was always very prompt and attentive. The breakfast buffet did not include packaged yogurts. People who enjoy the convenience of self parking can enter the Liberty Place garage which has an entrance directly beside the main hotel one. From the Mall near the Body Shop there is a door to the Westin hotel Entrance level where elevators take to the 2nd fl Lobby Level. From there near the Restaurant there are other elevators that take to the rooms. Location was perfect for the City Hall and Comcast Building a reasonable walk to the Historic Independence District.

Beautiful Hotel in a great location. The rooms and public spaces are nicely appointed. The hotel was built as a Ritz Carlton and it shows nice detailing luxurious bathrooms etc. We had a great stay with big comfortable beds wonderful staff and a terrific concierge. If we return to Philadelphia we would definitely stay there again.

Wifes Birthday. This past weekend my wife and I stayed at the Westin Philadelphia for her birthday. The location was remarkable. It is in walking distance or short cab ride to everywhere you want to be in center city Philadelphia. The room was excellent the accommodations where really nice and the personnel could not have been more professional and courteous. The Manager Mike who found out it was my wifes birthday. did everything he could to make her feel special except sing happy birthday to her in the lobby. I will stay here again and again.

Customer Service. Our customer service at this hotel was fantastic. In particular the concierge Geri Digins. She went above and beyond to help us out with restaurant ideas and directions along with finding out if we could get an earlier departure home. Thank you Geri.
Good staff lovely rooms.

So good in so many ways. The location is outstanding if you want to visit places in the city. Quick trip from the airport via cab about 30 without tip. There is attached shopping nothing beyond the usual chain stores but if you need something simple there is pleanty to choose from without having to brave the weather. I found a little black dress pantyhose costume jewelry dressy shawl all for under 150 when I found out the conference banquet was black tie preferred. The employees were all top notch professional and personable. Room service was good but very expensive with a 24 service charge. Conference food always has the possibility of mediocrity but not at the Westin. Continental breakfast lunch buffet and sit down banquet dinner was outstanding. Fresh and health options at every meal lovely service at the dinner. Cabs were readily available for trips out. Hot water was instantaneously available in the room rain shower head was fantastic. I also choose to go green and avoid daily linen service. Fitness center is standard but they only had one stationary bicycle and it is the spinning type. No pool here. I did not see that credited on the bill and there were two refreshment service charges that I did not have. Hopefully that will get sorted out so I can say without reservation this is top notch service and I will stay here when I am back in Phily.

Great hotel. Highly recommended. Excellent overall. Wide and comfortable room cleanly maintained. Great service by kindly smiling staff members. The only thing I could make complaints. about was a little bit of wear and tears. Some of the electrical outlets should be replaced can be dangerous and the hair dryer needs some cleaning too dusty. But otherwise this is a hotel with a reasonable price at the heart of Philadelphia. Highly recommended.

Fantastic Stay in Phily. The stay was exceptional. The staff accommodations were top notch to include some of the best tasting room service I have ever had. Valet front desk room service housekeeping every person I interacted with made me feel appreciated. Ca n’t wait to stay there again next month.

Excellent Three night stay. We arrived at the hotel late in the evening due to a flight that was three hours late. Despite that the room we were assigned was changed when I requested a quiet room and the new room was quiet away from the street. I had an excellent king bed and the AC also was excellent. We also received extra pillows despite the late hour. The service and stay were excellent.

Before leaving the hotel i discovered a roach on the floor. When contacting price line about the incident I was informed of Westin ’s comment made to Priceline “ We do n’t have a roach problem and this is the first I ’ve heard about this ” When leaving the hotel I sensed some anger from one of the staff members.

I encountered several problems during my stay. The first of which was that my initial room did smell strongly of cigarette smoke. After moving to a second room everything seemed fine except that the hotel had repairs scheduled for the room directly next door. This was not the construction downstairs I actually walked out of my room to see a repair man in the next room over. He was hammering away at what sounded like a pipe at 920 am This banging and hammering continued for a half an hour. When I told the front desk host checking me out she did not care and said oh the hotel was under construction. I was not happy with my stay based on these 2 experiences.

Tired Facility. The staff was very friendly. The facility is in dire need for a refurbishment. The phone in our room did n’t work the furniture was mismatched and somewhat shabby the bathroom was outdated even though it had a rain shower head which unfortunately was not properly seated against the shower wall. Finally both my wife and I thought the 24 service charge for room service was outrageous two continental breakfasts which nominally were 32 ended up costing over 64 with a tip. To say the least As a long time user of Mariot properties I was extremely disappointed with the facility and would not recommend it.

So disapointing does not qualify as a 4 star hotel. BEWARE POOR SERVICE I have contacted the Westin Philadelphia twice within 48 hours regarding 2 extraneous “ refreshment center ” charges on my bill I left 2 messages and my call has not been returned. Upon check out no staff asked about my stay offered to show me my bill and the valet was so rude. THE HOTEL IS UNDER CONSTRUCTION and unlike most Mariot hotels this is not indicated on the reservation information. This Westin is not worthy of a 4 star rating regardless of the construction that ’s ongoing for the following reasons the requests I made for “ additional items ” via the Mariot ap were not completed by the hotel staff. I phoned upon arrival to make the requests again and when the staff arrived they forget 13rd of my requests the room was not supplied with normal supplies including but not limited to slippers cotton swab cotton ball nail file kit enough toiletries and towels for 2 people which is what my reservation was for. the previous guest left personal items in the minibar milk and it had gone off. there was heavy construction above us before 10 am each weekend day. We know other guest were bothered because when we called service express they said other guests had also called about the disturbance. water and complimentary coffee were not sufficiently stocked either ran out before 4 pm each day or was not stocked at all. These are basic features of a 4 star hotel and the Westin is preferred by customers because we expect these features supplies compliments. the room service was appalling. The club sandwich and au jus arrived cold and soggy bread and the cheesecake had been in the refrigerator so long that the crust went soft when it was supposed to be crunchy cokiethe room was falling apart handles off dressers door stops hanging off rust in bathroom etcI love Westins but this one is not worth your time or money. There are plenty of nice hotels in the area. IHG is offering 15 of stays including the Kimpton very near the Westin Philadelphia for stays through April 30 2020. I suggest that instead even if you love Westin. They are going downhill since being purchased by Mariot.

Spent the night to celebrate our 10 year anniversary and location was awesome. Restaurant was around the corner entertainment was in walking distance and the one attraction my wife has wanted to see was only a block away. Only thing that would have been a little nicer it would have been helpful to know the hotel was under renovation. We were given a free drink voucher from the front desk at check in and were looking forward to sitting in the place we saw online and not a make shift bar in a conference room. Either way we got our drinks and enjoyed them in our room. Would definitely recommend The Westin and look forward to staying again.
